%-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
% CONFIGURATIONS
%-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
% NOTE: \documentclass must be in the main document file (resume.tex, cv.tex, coverletter.tex)

% Git integration for PDF metadata
% gitinfo2 reads from .git/gitHeadInfo.gin (generated by scripts/generate-git-info.sh)
% The maxdepth option allows finding .git from the documents/ subdirectory
\usepackage[maxdepth=4]{gitinfo2}

% Configure page margins with geometry
\geometry{left=1.4cm, top=.8cm, right=1.4cm, bottom=1.8cm, footskip=.5cm}

% Color for highlights
% Awesome Colors: awesome-emerald, awesome-skyblue, awesome-red, awesome-pink, awesome-orange
%                 awesome-nephritis, awesome-concrete, awesome-darknight
\colorlet{awesome}{awesome-darknight}
% Uncomment if you would like to specify your own color
% \definecolor{awesome}{HTML}{CA63A8}

% Colors for text
% Uncomment if you would like to specify your own color
\definecolor{darktext}{HTML}{515151}
% \definecolor{text}{HTML}{333333}
% \definecolor{graytext}{HTML}{5D5D5D}
% \definecolor{lighttext}{HTML}{999999}
% \definecolor{sectiondivider}{HTML}{5D5D5D}

% Set false if you don't want to highlight section with awesome color
\setbool{acvSectionColorHighlight}{false}

% If you would like to change the social information separator from a pipe (|) to something else
\renewcommand{\acvHeaderSocialSep}{\quadâ€¢\quad}

%-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
% SHARED PDF METADATA COMMAND
%-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
% Usage: \setupPDFMetadata{Document Type}{Additional Keywords}
% Example: \setupPDFMetadata{Resume}{Machine Learning, Data Science}
% Note: Must be called after personal.tex which defines \myfullname
% Note: Includes git branch and commit info from gitinfo2 package
\newcommand{\setupPDFMetadata}[2]{%
  \hypersetup{%
    pdftitle={\myfullname's #1},%
    pdfauthor={\myfullname <\myemail>},%
    pdfsubject={#1 for \myfullname},%
    pdfkeywords={#1, #2, \myfullname},%
    pdfproducer={LaTeX - \gitAbbrevHash{} on \gitBranch}%
  }%
}
